<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_run:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_run (struct MHD_Daemon *daemon)
{
  if ( (daemon->shutdown) ||
       MHD_D_IS_USING_THREADS_ (daemon) )
    return MHD_NO;

  (void) MHD_run_wait (daemon, 0);
  return MHD_YES;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if ( (daemon->shutdown) ||
       MHD_D_IS_USING_THREADS_ (daemon) )
    return MHD_NO;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 14.3 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the if controlling expression depends on daemon->shutdown and the result of MHD_D_IS_USING_THREADS_(daemon), both of which are runtime-dependent, so the expression is not invariant. (It would only violate Rule 14.3 if both operands were compile-time constants making the whole expression a constant.)
